category_description: Fade-based transitions including crossfades, dissolves, and focus transitions

transitions.name: instant-cut
transitions.long_description: Instantly switches to the new wallpaper without any animation or effect. This is the fastest transition option.

transitions.name: fade
transitions.long_description: Smooth crossfade transition that gradually blends from the old wallpaper to the new one. This is the most commonly used and visually pleasing transition.

transitions.name: fade-in
transitions.short_description: Fade from black to new image
transitions.long_description: Fades from a black screen to reveal the new wallpaper. Creates a clean entrance effect.

transitions.name: fade-out
transitions.short_description: Fade to black then reveal new
transitions.long_description: Fades the old wallpaper to black, then fades from black to the new wallpaper. Creates a dramatic pause effect.

transitions.name: crossfade
transitions.long_description: Another name for the classic fade transition. Provides smooth blending between wallpapers.

transitions.name: dissolve-white
transitions.long_description: Fades the old wallpaper to white, then fades from white to the new wallpaper. Creates a bright, energetic transition effect.

transitions.name: dissolve-black
transitions.long_description: Fades the old wallpaper to black, then fades from black to the new wallpaper. Similar to fade-out but optimized for dissolve effect.

transitions.name: focus-in
transitions.short_description: Blur shift from old to new
transitions.long_description: The old wallpaper gradually blurs out while the new wallpaper comes into focus. Creates a camera-like depth of field effect.

transitions.name: focus-out
transitions.short_description: Blur shift from new to old (reverse)
transitions.long_description: The new wallpaper starts blurred and comes into focus while the old wallpaper fades away. Reverse of focus-in effect.
